Comment: A modern chess master, with encyclopedic knowledge of every opening [even the unusual ones], would have no problem with this move. But Gerlach is caught off guard.
Gerlach responds by placing a Pawn in the center.
Guarding his advanced Pawn and opening a line for his KB.
Hoping to sucker Gerlach into his pitfall.
Winning a Pawn is a good move....
...but winning a Rook is a better one! Gerlach of course resigned.
